for_sales.sales_text: Gaff Cutter, designed by David Cannell and built by E G Edgcombe in1996 The hull is very heavy GRP with encapsulated ballast. The deck is ply with timber overlay.  Coachroof and cockpit in mahogany, the cockpit is self-draining.  The mast, bowsprit, boom and gaff are in pine. Displacement 3 Tonnes Cabin has 5ft .6 headroom, stbd side includes cooker recess (no cooker installed), sink and coolbox. Below is a stainless water tank (70lts) with hand pump to sink.   Port side has a berth , table and a quarter berth. Forepeak contains a Lavac toilet and storage for legs, dinghy etc. The engine is a Yammar 1GM10 driving a 2 blade prop and gives 5 knots.  the fuel locker is in the stern and holds 45lts. There are 2 batteries. Two self-tailing bronze winches in the cockpit. Sails are by James Lawrence and include:  Main   161sq ft JIB       82 Stay     71 Tops’l       40 all in fair condition The jib and stays’l are on Wykeham Martin furlers. Standing rigging and runners are 5mm s/s replaced 2023.   The following work was carried out in 2023/4: Cockpit seacocks replaced Stern gland packing renewed 12v wiring renewed Mains electric installed Wooden mast tabernacle replaced All spars and most exterior woodwork burned off and replaced with Sikkens wood protection New cockpit cover.   Having sailed a Tamarisk 29 for many enjoyable years, we were convinced that the 24ft version would be perfect for the two of us in old age.  However unfortunately ill health is forcing us to sell Tarka.
